intro: Alstroemeria ligtu f. haemantha, commonly known as the red alstroemeria, is a hybrid cultivar of the alstroemeria genus, native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers with a prominent yellow throat, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and a compact, bushy habit. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and containers. Its vibrant color and long-lasting blooms make it a favorite in floral arrangements.
